https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I-7Vp-wBGz8

Half live 2 has been a game that I always wanted to play in order to understand why this franchise is beloved by so many. Of course, I can not draw a direct comparison to my experience because when it released it was a groundbreaking game and even today you can still see some great aspects that really show how much thought went into the creation. 

I liked the clever designed puzzles and the variety in weapons. What really surprised me were all the small little details that happen along the way and for a game with this age behind it was still a great playing experience.

If I would have to say something negative about it would be that every time you go to a different region you are stuck in a load screen that pulls you out of the experience for a few seconds. 


As a conclusion while I don't consider this to be one of my favorite games, I can now relate into why it is so beloved. 

If you got time on your hands and the little money it costs then I would say go for it.

Very good game, definitely better than Source so far, and adds more human enemies to ramp up the difficulty. I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a good story driven FPS.

Also, although you can't tell to well in the preview images, has an extreme graphic overhaul since the first game and source, and for a game of its age, the landscape and cities look amazing. Very good game.

Been neglecting this series for too long. Bought it after completing Estranged Act I in two and a half hours. Looking forward to diving right into this game. The graphics have withstood the test of time and look great in 1440p. Still hoping to mod the game since my fps is near 300. Highly recommend this game if you don't own it yet.

It's the best game ever made, period. The graphics still hold on to this day, the story is a true masterpiece worthy of a literature Nobel. It takes us back to more simple times, when Valve knew what the people wanted and made astonishingly enjoyful videogames. I still hope that Valve comes back to its glory days, and Half Life is a beautiful example that maybe they could it if they put effort into it.
